availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James J. Cantrell (Green County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Ellmore Cantrell in Green County, Kentucky, on October 13, 1841. Father of Arrabel Cantrell, Elizabeth Cantrell, Nancy E. Cantrell, Peter Cantrell, Martha Cantrell, Asa L. Cantrell, Cynthia A. Cantrell, Benjamin T. Cantrell, Thomas J. Cantrell, Sarah F. Cantrell, and Julia A. Cantrell. Farmer in Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Green County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 140B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1, pp. 674-675
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, Lower Brush Creek Precinct, p. 488A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994036, Green County Births.
Kentucky, County Marriages, 1797-1954, Genealogical Society of Salt Lake City, Salt Lake City, UT, Green County Marriages, Film 000594644.
"James Jefferson Cantrell (1821-1899)," Find A Grave, Memorial 43530557, accessed March 31, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/43530557.
